skill.name: traffic-analysis
skill.description: Analyze network traffic patterns, identify top applications and bandwidth usage, and optimize traffic management. Perform DPI-based traffic classification.
skill.summary: Analyze network traffic patterns, identify top applications and bandwidth usage, and optimize traffi...
skill.author: DataKnifeAI

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation-only skill (SKILL.md) with no executable code. It defines prompts and tool descriptions for an AI assistant. The actual functionality is implemented in the UniFi Network MCP server which is separate from this skill definition. No file access, network calls, command execution, or environment variable access is performed by this skill file.

content.value_statement: Network administrators need visibility into bandwidth usage and application traffic to optimize performance and plan capacity. This skill provides AI-powered traffic analysis using DPI classification to identify bandwidth consumers and recommend optimization strategies.
actual_capabilities: Identify applications in use with DPI classification
Analyze bandwidth usage by client and application
Track traffic patterns and trends over time
Recommend traffic optimization and QoS policies
Identify bandwidth bottlenecks and congestion causes
limitations: Requires UniFi Network MCP server to be running
Does not modify network configuration, only reads data
Traffic history limited to what the UniFi controller retains
Cannot block or throttle traffic directly

use_cases.title: Bandwidth optimization
use_cases.description: Identify bandwidth-heavy applications and users to optimize QoS policies and improve network performance.

use_cases.title: Capacity planning
use_cases.description: Analyze traffic trends to plan bandwidth upgrades and justify network infrastructure investments.

use_cases.title: Troubleshoot congestion
use_cases.description: Diagnose network slowdowns by correlating DPI categories with bandwidth usage to identify bottlenecks.

prompt_templates.title: Basic traffic overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the top applications consuming bandwidth on the network

prompt_templates.title: Client bandwidth ranking
prompt_templates.prompt: List the top 10 bandwidth-consuming clients with their traffic volumes

prompt_templates.title: Category breakdown
prompt_templates.prompt: Break down network traffic by DPI category and show traffic volumes for each category

prompt_templates.title: Optimization recommendations
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze current traffic patterns and recommend QoS policies to optimize network performance

output_examples.input: Show me the top applications consuming bandwidth and identify optimization opportunities
output: Top Bandwidth Consumers: Streaming services (45%), Gaming (25%), Web browsing (15%), Cloud backup (10%), Other (5%)
Optimization Recommendations: Prioritize video conferencing during business hours, limit streaming quality for non-critical devices, implement traffic shaping for backup jobs during off-peak hours

best_practices: Monitor traffic patterns regularly to establish baseline and detect anomalies early
Correlate DPI categories with business policies to prioritize critical applications
Use traffic data to justify bandwidth upgrades with quantifiable evidence
anti_patterns: Ignoring unusual traffic patterns that may indicate security issues
Applying QoS policies without understanding actual bandwidth consumption patterns
Focusing only on bandwidth numbers without considering application categories

faq.question: What UniFi devices are supported?
faq.answer: Any UniFi device with a UniFi Network controller. The skill works with Dream Machine, UniFi Switch, and UniFi Access Point data.

faq.question: How much historical traffic data is available?
faq.answer: Traffic history depends on your UniFi controller retention settings. Typically 7-30 days of detailed data is available.

faq.question: Does this skill modify network settings?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reads traffic data from the UniFi controller. Configuration changes require separate management tools.

faq.question: How is my traffic data protected?
faq.answer: Traffic data stays within your UniFi controller. This skill only queries existing data and does not transmit information externally.

faq.question: Why am I seeing unknown applications?
faq.answer: DPI may not recognize all traffic. New applications, encrypted traffic, or custom protocols may appear as unknown. Consider updating DPI signatures.

faq.question: How does this compare to other network monitoring tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-powered analysis on top of UniFi data. It complements tools like UniFi Network app by offering natural language queries and automated recommendations.
